items.summary: Lots of people like this place

items.description: From pizza to cupcakes, dumplings to sushi and (well) beyond, the very best places to eat in New York City, as featured on http://www.thepurplepassport.com.

tip.text: The food here is fantastic (it does have a Michelin star, after all). Don’t just come for drinks! Good to know: Unless you’re showingup for lunch (or anytime before 5:00pm), waits are inevitable.

items.name: Eating New York City

items.description: From the pastrami sandwich at Katz's to Balthazar's pomme frites, there are some dishes that are classic NYC. Foursquare's data scientists identified the top 50, and we challenge you to try them all.

user.firstName: The Tastes that Make the City
The Tastes that Make the City

tip.text: The ricotta gnudi is the best gnudi in NYC, making our list of "The Tastes That Make the City: NYC Edition."

user.firstName: The Tastes that Make the City
The Tastes that Make the City

items.name: The Tastes that Make the City: New York Edition

items.text: Chef April Bloomfield holds her own and then some at New York's top gastropub. Arguably the best restaurant burger in New York is served here, and the gnudi needs no introduction. [Eater 38 Member]
A must-stop whenever I am in NYC. Gnudi are killer, best burger, and on my last visit the peas were a revelation. -Preeti Mistry, Top Chef
The ricotta gnudi is the best gnudi in NYC, making our list of "The Tastes That Make the City: NYC Edition."

user.firstName: The Tastes that Make the City

items.text: CNN Eatocracy: Devils on Horseback, chicken liver & a burger with Roquefort are a few of its hearty offerings. A 2 hr wait is normal during peak hours, as is celeb-spotting in the witching hours.
Such great food. I can’t resist going there every time I go to New York. -Susan Feniger, Top Chef
Gastropubby goodness. You should be thrown out for ordering a salad here. If you can't do the massive burger, at least do a couple duck eggs. [BlackBook]

user.firstName: How To Make It In America

items.text: The best restaurant burger in NYC is served here, as anyone who has braved the two-hour wait for a table can tell you.

user.firstName: How To Make It In America

items.text: One of my favorite places. -Jacqueline Laurita, Real Housewives of NJ
Gastropubs are popping up everywhere, but the Spotted Pig is one of the best. Head down to this West Village hotspot for stellar gnudi, haddock chowder, and a couple of the hearty house ales.
One of best places for a lauded char-grilled burger with Roquefort cheese. The wait is always a long one though.
Mario Batali brings British gastropub fare to the West Village at the local and celeb favorite, The Spotted Pig.
take the wait time they give you and divide by two. it's never nearly as long as they say
Get the cubano sandwich
One Michelin star.
the gnudi's my most favorite thing here (and has been for a few years!)
Dine early-bird at the Spotted Pig; you won’t have to fight the crowds for a table and there’s no risk they’ll run out of the amazing ice cream,freshly made each day. - Inspector

For a good value red, opt for Chateau de Peyregrandes' Faugères AOC (Languedoc). Faugères wines are full-bodied with herbal bouquets and mineral notes. Perfect for this gastropub's cuisine. agwine.com
This quaint little West Village gastropub is good for a casual lunch.  If you're adventurous get the popular chicken liver toast, otherwise the burger and fries are mighty fine too.
Go to the spotted pig and order the Deviled Eggs ... best in the city!
Mario Batali brings British gastropub fare to the West Village at the local and celeb favorite, The Spotted Pig. We recommend Sheep's Milk Ricotta Gnudi. Find more tips at Food Network Local.

sample.text: ... or 2 in advance. Get ricotta gnudi, deviled eggs and the burger of course.
... (best I've ever had), chicken liver toast
The deviled eggs are heaven, but you really can't go wrong...
